TestInfo.name: framework/Samplers/AdaptiveBatch.InvalidPostRankingSimplification
TestInfo.author: maljdan
TestInfo.description:
An example of using the limit surface post-processor with an invalid threshold value. This should degrade gracefully by defaulting to a threshold of 0 and warning the user of the change made to the execution.
Note, all of the tests in AdaptiveBatch operate on a 2D input domain with the goal of extracting a circular limit surface with radius 0.5 and centered at the origin, (0,0).

revisions.revision: Collapsing the batch sampling into the limit surface class, updating documentation, XSD, and the test cases to reflect this change.

Adjusting the invalid thickness example to replicate the default distancePersistence scoring function rather than the distance scoring function (which fails on the HPC for some yet undiscovered reason).
First update, looking for more failing tests to add.
Updating test cases to reflect the changes to the user input.
Simplifying test case to use a linear limit surface with a linear kernel svm and abstracting common components of test cases
